title: Improving Mathematics Learning Outcomes Through MOOC Content Design and Self-Directed Learning

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge (linear algebra, calculus, etc.)
context.additional_context: Hybrid learning environment utilizing digital devices (tablets, laptops)

learning_goals: Learners understand MOOC content design principles (components, assessment methods) at a level where they can apply them with over 80% proficiency.
Learners complete math problem-solving projects (3 instances) with over 90% accuracy using self-directed learning strategies.
Learners fully perform peer feedback (2 instances) during the process of creating and sharing learning materials with digital tools.

resources: Digital Tools for Mathematics Education (e.g., GeoGebra)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
